definition: son/child/seed/egg/small thing/1st earthly branch: 11 p.m.-1 a.m., midnight, 11th solar month (7th December to 5th January), year of the Rat/Viscount, fourth of five orders of nobility 五等爵位[wu3 deng3 jue2 wei4]/ancient Chinese compass point: 0° (north)

sentences.english: My only child has just started boarding-school.
sentences.chinese: 我的独子刚刚开始他寄宿学校的生活。

sentences.english: I was living the life of an only child and loving it.
sentences.chinese: 我正在享受着独子生活并且热爱着这样的生活。

sentences.english: I was a single child and grew up on a farm in Minquan.
sentences.chinese: 俺生在民权村的一个农家，是家里的独子。

sentences.english: Born in south Hopei, he was the only son of a peasant family.
sentences.chinese: 他出身于冀南一个农民家庭，是个独子。

sentences.english: Jim was an only son of his parents.
The craftsman taught his son and heir how to make pots.
sentences.chinese: 向他的独子传授了制罐的手艺。

sentences.english: The couple lavished so much care on their only son.
sentences.chinese: 夫妇俩过分关心他们的独子。

definition: Zhangzi county in Shanxi 山西[Shan1 xi1]
at the knee (in reference to children)/(salutation used in letters to parents or grandparents)
to have lost both one's parents
